clue: Take issue with model at work
hints: Work can mean operate, or OP for short
What do models do when being photographed?
This means to 'Take issue with'
Think about how the word OP can be combined with what models do
When you 'take issue' with something you stand against it
explanation: The word here is OPPOSE, in this case the first half of the clue is the meaning of the word. You can work out from the cryptic clues 'work = OP' and to 'model you POSE'

clue: Bandit not at home on principle
hints: It probably is a word for 'bandit' or 'principle'
If you are not 'at home' you are ....
A Principle is like a rules or ...
You can make up the word by solving the smaller bits. 'Not at home' is the first part of the word, and another word for 'principle' is the second
This is another word for BANDIT
explanation: This is OUTLAW, another word for a bandit. If you are not at home you are OUT and principle can mean LAW
